intro: Euphrasia officinalis subsp. montana, commonly known as the mountain eyebright, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. The plant features upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers with five petals and prominent yellow spots. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
